title: Freezing after Windows 10 Anniversary update
body: After updating my computer (Windows 10 Anniversary update), my computer keeps freezing while in loading screen or in-game. The sound keeps cutting out and I can play for about two minutes, then I need to restart the computer and reconnect after it freezes. Any ideas how I can fix or anyone having this issue too? I don't know very much about fixing these things

replies.body: I FIXED IT. So what I did I right clicked on league of legends and clicked on properties, then I went under the compatibility tab and I clicked on the box where it says "Run this program in compatibility mode for:" and then I selected windows 7. Then I went into a custom and it actually worked! I hope this helps some of you out there.

> [{quoted}](name=Shisuro,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=5k9wXHTT,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2016-08-11T05:08:11.545+0000)

Well I got banned due to 4 dcs in a row due to the fcking freezing on a BRAND NEW laptop. If this works, you sir deserve a cookie.
same but I got 20 minutes waiting for 15 games as I dced 3 times in a row and lost 80 lp thank god this actually worked off and now I can finally play normally

But i cant even make it to the login screen without windows freezing

Read my comment fam.

Last night I updated windows 10 and when I tried playing League today, as soon as the game starts at 0:00 my whole computer freezes and I can't Ctrl+Alt+Delete out or Alt+tab so I'm forced to hard reset. I've reinstalled the game twice now but no luck, any suggestions?
THIS IS STILL A SOLUTION! I frickin love you man thank you so much.
Ty so much

Hell yeah, my almost new gaming laptop kept freezing on the first screen after the game starts, so I read a bit bout it and did the 2 recommended things - I installed  the latest java version and ran the compatibility troubleshooter, dont know what exactly solevd the problem but the game runs fine now, thx for the advice people. I poured fire and brimstone on the heads of the guys from the maufacterers service centre...turns out I was wrong and the laptop is not dead...next time will know better.
Thank you so much
Same thing happpened to me. I had to update my drivers, once I did it seemed to fix the problem.
Same issue here. Updating of drivers did **not** help. I am having an Intel NUC.
I've tried everything. I did a factory reset, updated all the drivers, re-installed league and it still freezes. I'm about to send my laptop off to Dell.
http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/BtG1PKdE-after-anniversary-update-for-win-10-sound-and-fps-issues-lagscracklingfreezin-solved
Updating my drivers didn't work for me, so I went to settings and back to the old build. Then everything works fine again

Holy shit, I actually love you.

My computer has been freezing every time I go into game since I upgraded to Windows 10 last night. I tried refragging my comp, checking the drivers, and a bunch of other stuff.

Thanks so much for helping me figure this out!

EDIT: oops, I didn't post under the right parent comment. That happens when you post on mobile, I guess. Thanks Shisuro!

I FIXED IT TOO!
I disabled Windows Game Bar, apparently the new update fucks shit up for that feature. 
Use this website:
http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html
Rly thank you man... It is fixed now... :)
I Am having the same problem. My Drives are up to date, and I ran Ccleaner and that has not fixed the problem.

First of all, Venom, I know you've sought help here before and I'm really glad to hear your issue has been fixed!  

Kabb, it sounds like this could be happening for a few reasons like outdated drivers or something else entirely.  I'd like to rule out some possibilities by asking you to go over our [FPS issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) guide.  Make sure to go through each step, especially updating your drivers since your windows update.  Let me know the results, and we can go from there!

Thanks for your reply! So I updated my driver and reinstalled League, but I went back to the old build of Windows 10 but now I need to reinstall League. Unfortunately, I moved it to the trash and then emptied it..now the computer can't find the files to uninstall or something like that, do you know what I can do? (Sorry, I'm a noob when it comes to stuff like this)

EDIT: So I searched around my computer and in the Riot Games folder I clicked on lol.launcher, then the launcher/client worked! The in-game issues are fixed too! Obviously it's not perfect and not as good as it used to be. but it works. I'm not sure if my Alpha Client will work though

Sounds like a messy situation!  You can use our[ hextech repair tool ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs)to help reinstall the game!  If you have any issues, our[ reinstall league ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202539040-Reinstalling-League-of-Legends)guide can help make sure everything is installed correctly.
